item.title: Mars Terraforming
item.description: C02 dominated atmosphere billions of years ago Global magnetic field shutdown 4.2 billlion of years ago The atmospheric CO2 has been out of the solar system which may not be possible to bring it back Methane is suspected to be stable in the Martian atmosphere for only about 300 years, so whatever is generating this gas did so recently.Â volcanic activity The planet’s atmospheric pressure is too low, at about 1/100th of Earth’s, for liquid water to last on the surface.
